title: Beltre talks his way into Game 4 lineup
text:

The Rangers third baseman, out of action since the early portions of Game 1 due to a  //on.wfaa.com/1Lr39S5   Beltre talks his way into Game 4 lineup Mike Leslie, WFAA Sports 2:22 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Adrian Beltre is helped off the field in the third inning after an injury sustained against the Toronto Blue Jays in game one of the ALDS at Rogers Centre. (Photo: Nick Turchiaro-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Adrian Beltre is persuasive. And he's also gritty as they come. 
The Rangers third baseman, out of action since the early portions of Game 1 due to a stiff back, was able to talk his way into the Game 4 lineup today, after Texas had initially not listed Beltre in their starting nine. 
Beltre took batting practice at the indoor cage inside Globe Life Park, and also did some light jogging. After loosening up, he proclaimed himself ready to play. 
Just like that, he's on the hot corner for Texas. 
Beltre replaces Hanser Alberto, who was initially slated to start at 3rd, and who has done an admirable job in Beltre's stead, including a game-winning RBI single in the 14th inning of Game 2. 
But Beltre is Beltre. And if he says he can play, he'll play. 
The new Texas lineup, with Beltre on the field, is as follows: 
DeShields 8; Choo 9; Beltre 5; Fielder DH; Moreland 3; Andrus 6; Hamilton 7; Odor 4; Chirinos 2 Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1Lr39S5 TOP VIDEOS
